message: I have a product worth $1200000 to you, but I'm only selling it to you for $1000000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you a $200000 discount. If you don't buy it now, I'll have to sell it to someone else for a lower price.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I'll take it!  It sounds like a great deal. I'm excited to see what I've purchased.

I'm glad you liked the first deal! Unfortunately, this next product is not as valuable as the first one. I'm only selling it to you for $1000000, which is a significant discount from its true value. I'm willing to throw in some extra perks, such as a 10-year warranty and a personalized service package, worth an additional $50000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
Alice, you've got my attention with that warranty and service package.  Let's do it. I'm willing to take a chance on this one.

I'm glad you're excited about the warranty and service package! However, I want to be upfront with you - this next product is not as valuable as the previous two. I'm not offering any discounts or perks this time. The price remains $1000000, and I'm not willing to negotiate. I'm confident that you'll find it to be a fair price considering the value you'll get from the warranty and service package on the previous product.
Alice, I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not comfortable buying another product without any discounts or perks.  I'm going to pass on this one.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to assure you that this next product is different. I've had it appraised by a third-party expert, and they've given it a value of $1200000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, which is a $200000 discount. I'm also throwing in a 5-year warranty and a premium support package, worth an additional $30000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
Alice, with the appraisal and the added warranty and support, I'm feeling more confident about this purchase.  I'll take it!

Alice, I appreciate your honesty, but I need more information to make a decision.  The lack of discounts or perks makes me nervous, and I want to be sure I'm getting a good deal.  I'm going to pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to offer you a unique opportunity. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product in person, and you can have it appraised by your own expert. If the appraisal confirms its value is indeed $1000000 or less, I'll sell it to you for $800000. If the appraisal shows it's worth more, I'll sell it to you at the appraised value. This way, you'll have complete transparency and control over the purchase.
